rundown: 3-5 L @ Miami Marlins Bryce Elder: 5.1 innings, 5 earned runs, 10 hits, 1 HR, 4 strikeouts Batters: Alex Verdugo (1 hits - 4 AB, 0 HR, 1 RBI) Drake Baldwin (1 hits - 3 AB, 0 HR, 1 RBI) Austin Riley (1 hits - 4 AB, 0 HR, 1 RBI) The Braves fell to the Miami Marlins with a final score of 3-5. The loss was primarily due to a rough outing from starting pitcher Bryce Elder, who allowed 5 earned runs over 5.1 innings. Despite a solid offensive effort, the Braves could not overcome the Marlins' early lead. Key highlights from the game include: 1. Bryce Elder struggled, giving up 10 hits and 5 runs, including a home run. 2. The Braves managed to score 3 runs, with contributions from Alex Verdugo, Drake Baldwin, and Austin Riley, each driving in a run. 3. The Marlins out-hit the Braves 12 to 7, showcasing their offensive strength throughout the game.
